sn56.9:4.2: ‘You don’t understand this teaching and training. I understand this teaching and training.
sn56.9:4.3: What, you understand this teaching and training?
sn56.9:4.4: You’re practicing wrong. I’m practicing right.
sn56.9:4.5: I stay on topic, you don’t.
sn56.9:4.6: You said last what you should have said first. You said first what you should have said last.
sn56.9:4.7: What you’ve thought so much about has been disproved.
sn56.9:4.8: Your doctrine is refuted. Go on, save your doctrine!
sn56.9:4.9: You’re trapped; get yourself out of this—if you can!’
sn56.9:4.11: Because those discussions aren’t beneficial or relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. They don’t lead to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
sn56.9:5.1: When you discuss, you should discuss: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’. …
sn56.9:5.2: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
